title: Theme A - Design Policy 1
body: Utilize a people-first design, ensuring that roadways are moving people efficiently and providing pedestrian infrastructure that is context sensitive to the vehicle environment and land uses.

title: Theme A - Design Policy 2
body: Ensure proper road connections are in place to enhance service times and access to fire and police services for all residents.

title: Theme A - Design Policy 3
body: Multi-family residential developments should comply with the multi-family design standards in Appendix A.

title: Theme A - Design Policy 4
body: Provide development that is sensitive to the surrounding context.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Economic Development, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme A - Design Policy 5
body: Provide pedestrian friendly street patterns and walkable blocks to create inviting streetscapes.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme A - Design Policy 6
body: Adhere to the recommendations of the Lexington Area MPO Bike/Pedestrian Master Plan, adopted in 2018.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Economic Development, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme A - Design Policy 7
body: Design car parking areas so as not to be the primary visual component of the neighborhood.

title: Theme A - Design Policy 8
body: Provide varied housing choice.

title: Theme A - Design Policy 9
body: Provide adequate greenspace for all neighborhoods within walking distance.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme A - Design Policy 10
body: Provide neighborhood focal points accessible to all residents.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Economic Development, Greenspace, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme A - Design Policy 11
body: Single loaded streets should be utilized in order to establish clear public access to neighborhood focal points.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme A - Design Policy 12
body: Support neighborhood level commercial areas.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme A - Design Policy 13
body: Development should connect to adjacent stub streets and maximize the street network.

title: Theme A - Density Policy 1
body: The highest density of our residential development should be directed to our major corridors and downtown.

title: Theme A - Density Policy 2
body: Infill residential can and should aim to increase density while enhancing existing neighborhoods through context sensitive design.

title: Theme A - Density Policy 3
body: Create opportunities for additional neighborhood supportive uses, especially in areas where services are lacking.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Quality of Life

title: Theme A - Density Policy 4
body: Generally, locate high-density areas of development along higher capacity roadways (minor arterial, collector) to facilitate future transit enhancements.

title: Theme A - Density Policy 5
body: Provide affordable and/or compact residential options through Accessory Dwelling Units.

title: Theme A - Density Policy 6
body: Allow and encourage new compact single-family housing types.

title: Theme A - Equity Policy 1
body: Meet the demand for housing across all income levels.

title: Theme A - Equity Policy 2
body: Provide affordable housing across all areas, affirmatively furthering fair housing, complying with HUD guidance.

title: Theme A - Equity Policy 3
body: Add residential opportunities by proactively up-zoning areas near transit for populations who rely solely on public transportation.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Quality of Life

title: Theme A - Equity Policy 4
body: Preserve and enhance existing affordable housing through the land bank, community land trust and vacant land commission.

title: Theme A - Equity Policy 5
body: Protect affordable housing tenants through improved code enforcement policies.

title: Theme A - Equity Policy 6
body: Provide flexibility for senior housing through Accessory Dwelling Units.

title: Theme A - Equity Policy 7
body: Community facilities should be well integrated into their respective neighborhoods.
field_topics: topic: Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme A - Equity Policy 8
body: Housing developments should implement Universal Design principles on a portion of their units.

title: Theme B - Protection Policy 1
body: Continue the Sanitary Sewer Capacity Assurance Program (CAP) and encourage the Stormwater Incentive Grant program to reduce impacts of development on water quality.

title: Theme B - Protection Policy 2
body: Conserve environmentally sensitive areas, including significant natural habitats, wetlands and water bodies.

title: Theme B - Protection Policy 3
body: Continue to implement PDR program to safeguard Lexington’s rural land.

title: Theme B - Protection Policy 4
body: Conserve active agriculture land in the Rural Service Area while promoting a creative food chain network.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Agriculture, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme B - Protection Policy 5
body: Promote and connect local farms with the community through integrated partnerships.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Agriculture, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme B - Protection Policy 6
body: Promote context- sensitive agritourism in the Rural Service Area.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Agriculture, Quality of Life

title: Theme B - Protection Policy 7
body: Protect sensitive natural habitats and wildlife in the Urban Service Area, protect the urban forest, and significant tree canopies in crucial ecological networks.

title: Theme B - Protection Policy 8
body: Integrate the Greenspace Plan into urban and rural area.
field_topics: topic: Agriculture, Greenspace, Quality of Life

title: Theme B - Protection Policy 9
body: Respect the geographic context of natural land, encourage development to protect steep slope; and locate building structures to reduce unnecessary earth disruption.

title: Theme B - Protection Policy 10
body: Install iconic rural fencelines around major greenways and creeks to enhance their natural beauty.

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 1
body: Develop a multi-modal transportation network and infrastructure; seek collaboration with regional transit partners for the commuting public.

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 2
body: Promote roadway, pedestrian and bicycle connectivity.

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 3
body: Encourage Transit-Oriented Development, increase density along major corridors and in the Infill and Redevelopment Area to support transit ridership, thus reducing vehicle miles traveled (VMT).
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Health

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 4
body: Make recommendations to locate new development within walking distance of existing greenspace / community centers, or create greenspace / community centers within walking distance of residential uses.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 5
body: Reduce / discourage vehicle oriented development patterns, such as drive-through businesses within the Urban Service Boundary, especially in the urban core areas. Reduce parking footprints.

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 6
body: Apply traffic mitigation programs, such as communication with employers to encourage flexible work schedules or telecommuting.

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 7
body: Continue and expand energy efficiency initiatives, promote energy efficient buildings by supporting grants and public recognition.

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 8
body: Encourage Lexington to join the STAR Community rating program.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Agriculture, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 9
body: Develop and proactively share educational materials and programs to increase public awareness of energy efficiency benefits and services.

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 10
body: Enhance Lexington’s recycling and waste management programs.

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 11
body: Require green infrastructure elements for new development, and require during redevelopment where appropriate.

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 12
body: Encourage and explore incentives for green building practices for new development and redevelopment.

title: Theme B - Sustainability Policy 13
body: Develop an overarching entity / organization for existing environmentally-focused agencies to collaborate on sustainability programs and follow through on implementation.
field_topics: topic: Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme B - Restoration Policy 1
body: Follow the LFUCG Urban Forestry Management Plan, protecting and recovering Lexington’s urban forest by strategically planting new trees and creating walkable streetscapes.
field_topics: topic: Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme B - Restoration Policy 2
body: Use green infrastructure to bridge gaps in the greenspace network.
field_topics: topic: Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme B - Restoration Policy 3
body: Support community gardens and urban agriculture to restore natural resources within the Urban Service Area.
field_topics: topic: Agriculture, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme B - Restoration Policy 4
body: Improve air quality by reducing vehicle miles traveled (VMT).

title: Theme C - Livability Policy 1
body: Encourage economic opportunities for a wide array of agritourism while preserving the Bluegrass identity.

title: Theme C - Livability Policy 2
body: Emphasize the preservation, protection, and promotion of the iconic Bluegrass landscape along rural gateways and roadways serving as primary tourist routes.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Economic Development, Agriculture, Greenspace

title: Theme C - Livability Policy 3
body: Create a large regional athletic field complex for economic development and to enhance Lexington’s existing facilities.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme C - Livability Policy 4
body: Continue to coordinate transportation logistics and traffic control for recurring special events, festivals, and parades.

title: Theme C - Livability Policy 5
body: Enhance programs and activities by Lexington’s Parks and Recreation Department, and support public event planning, community events, and festivals.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme C - Livability Policy 6
body: Attract and retain young professionals by improving affordable housing opportunities, amenities, and entertainment options that are attractive to them.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Economic Development, Quality of Life

title: Theme C - Livability Policy 7
body: Continue to create a true multimodal and mixed-use community with safe and quality access to community facilities, greenspace, employment, neighborhoods businesses, shopping, and entertainment.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme C - Livability Policy 8
body: Promote quality of life aspects, including greenspace, as an attraction to new businesses and residents.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme C - Livability Policy 9
body: Promote economic development through the preservation of strategically and appropriately located industrial and production zoned land.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Quality of Life

title: Theme C - Diversity Policy 1
body: Create opportunities for incubators. Seek incentives for owners of vacant office/laboratory space, and for developers who build incubator space for startups and for growing businesses.

title: Theme C - Diversity Policy 2
body: Encourage a diverse economic base to provide a variety of job opportunities, allowing upward mobility for lower income residents of Fayette County

title: Theme C - Diversity Policy 3
body: Support full funding and adequate staff for the Minority Business Enterprise Program (MBEP) which increases diversification of city vendors through promoting an increase in minority, veteran, and women-owned companies doing business with the city.

title: Theme C - Diversity Policy 4
body: Encourage training, programs, and workforce inclusion opportunities for people with disabilities or judicial records, or who have undergone rehabilitation from addiction.

title: Theme C - Diversity Policy 5
body: Maximize context-sensitive employment opportunities within the Opportunity Zone tracts, providing equitable community development, and prioritizing local residents for advancement opportunities.

title: Theme C - Diversity Policy 6
body: Increase flexibility on types of home occupations allowed.

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 1
body: Promote hiring local residents, and recruit employees living in areas of construction projects.

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 2
body: Support the continued funding for Economic Development grants and the Commonwealth Infrastructure fund, as well as Lexington’s Public Infrastructure Fund.

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 3
body: Continue to protect the Agricultural Cluster and equine industry, and support existing agricultural uses, while promoting new innovative agricultural uses in the Rural Service Area.

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 4
body: Encourage installation of fiber-optic broadband infrastructure for high-tech and other industries.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Economic Development, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 5
body: Continue to raise awareness of farms and farm tours.

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 6
body: Promote Kentucky Proud & local Lexington products using unified branding.

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 7
body: Support & increase networking opportunities for career related institutions, organizations, & agencies.

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 8
body: Provide employment opportunities that match the graduating majors from local colleges and vocational training institutions

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 9
body: Recruit professional services that utilize vacant office space.

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 10
body: Encourage flexible parking and shared parking arrangements.

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 11
body: Expand job opportunities through education and training to retain existing businesses and attract new ones.

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 12
body: Work with the Mayor’s Office to create a long-range plan for the 250 acres of Lexington’s publically-controlled economic development land at Coldstream Research Campus.

title: Theme C - Prosperity Policy 13
body: Promote increasing the supply of farm workers, and the availability and affordability of using agricultural technology, and agricultural equipment.

title: Theme D - Connectivity Policy 1
body: Street design should reflect and promote the desired place-type.

title: Theme D - Connectivity Policy 2
body: Create multimodal streets that satisfy all user needs.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme D - Connectivity Policy 3
body: Provide equitable multi-modal access for those who do not drive due to age, disability, expense, or choice.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme D - Connectivity Policy 4
body: Designstreet networks that provide alternative route options, which reduces traffic congestion.

title: Theme D - Connectivity Policy 5
body: Streets should be designed for the desired speed, using built-in traffic calming measures such as roundabouts, narrower street widths, chicanes, medians, etc.

title: Theme D - Connectivity Policy 6
body: Take a holistic approach to designing context-sensitive streets, addressing them within the framework of the countywide network context and the needs of all users.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 1
body: Implement the Town Branch Commons Strategic Master Plan as an element of the Comprehensive Plan.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Economic Development, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 2
body: Retrofit incomplete suburban developments, incorporating elements that create complete neighborhoods.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 3
body: Establish design standards for placemaking.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Greenspace, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 4
body: Create quality and useable open space for all developments over one acre.
field_topics: topic: Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 5
body: Review zoning ordinance and subdivision regulations to create more walkable places.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 6
body: Amend the Expansion Area Master Plan to update the remaining residential area to reflect the 2018 Comprehensive Plan’s Goals and Objectives.

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 7
body: Cultivate a more collaborative pre-development process, incorporating community feedback before development is formally submitted for review.

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 8
body: Develop a tactical placemaking program within the Division of Planning to work with interested neighborhoods and aid in the organization of activities.

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 9
body: Honor Lexington’s history by requiring new development and redevelopments to enhance the cultural, physical, and natural resources that have shaped the community.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Economic Development, Greenspace, Quality of Life

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 10
body: Coordinate with the Public Art commission to designate public art easements on new development that would be curated by the Commission.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 11
body: Update the Adaptive Reuse Ordinance
field_topics: topic: Housing, Economic Development, Quality of Life

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 12
body: Analyze underutilized commercial property through corridor land use and transportation studies.

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 13
body: Update the Downtown Master Plan.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Greenspace, Quality of Life

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 14
body: Pursue a regional park system.
field_topics: topic: Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme D - Placemaking Policy 15
body: Develop a new citywide festival to entice visitors and provide additional draw during the tourism off-season.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Quality of Life

title: Theme D - Support Policy 1
body: Ensure school sites are designed to integrate well into the surrounding neighborhood.
field_topics: topic: Transportation, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme D - Support Policy 2
body: Incorporate natural components into school site design to further the goals of Theme B (Protecting the Environment), but also to provide calming elements that reduce student stress and anxiety.
field_topics: topic: Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme D - Support Policy 3
body: Support the maintenance and expansion of a robust wireless communications network creating reliable service throughout Lexington’s urban and rural areas.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme D - Support Policy 4
body: Provide equitable healthcare opportunities throughout Lexington to allow for the wide range of medical needs of all populations.

title: Theme D - Support Policy 5
body: Provide equity in social services by ensuring those in need are served by social service community facilities that address homelessness, substance abuse, mental health, and other significant issues.

title: Theme D - Support Policy 6
body: Ensure all social service and community facilities are safely accessible via mass transit, bicycle, and pedestrian transportation modes.

title: Theme D - Support Policy 7
body: Continue to support the provision of high speed internet services throughout Lexington.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme D - Support Policy 8
body: Build upon the success of the Senior Citizens’ Center to provide improved quality of life opportunities for the largest growing population demographic.
field_topics: topic: Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme D - Support Policy 9
body: Implement creative housing opportunities that are both accessible & affordable for seniors & people with disabilities.

title: Theme E - Accountability Policy 1
body: Create a new process for determining long-term land use decisions involving the Urban Service Boundary (USB) and Rural Activity Centers.

title: Theme E - Accountability Policy 2
body: Modernize the Zoning Ordinance to reflect the direction of the 2018 Comprehensive Plan, proactively planning for the next 20 years of growth.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Agriculture, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme E - Accountability Policy 3
body: Implement the Placebuilder, which includes criteria for zone change applications, based upon the goals and objectives, to ensure development compliance with the Comprehensive Plan.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Agriculture, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme E - Accountability Policy 4
body: Develop growth benchmarks and determine best measurable methods to monitor them and report progress on a regular basis.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Agriculture, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme E - Accountability Policy 5
body: Increase dedicated bike lanes, pedestrian and transit facilities in the existing right-of-way, focusing on moving people rather than exclusively single-occupancy vehicles.

title: Theme E - Accountability Policy 6
body: Partner with other agencies like the Lexington Public Library to create a public outreach opportunity that provides decision-makers with input and creates neighborhood leaders across all demographics and geographies.
field_topics: topic: Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme E - Stewardship Policy 1
body: Update Lexington’s stone fence inventory, and pursue additional protections for this iconic and historic cultural asset.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Agriculture, Greenspace, Quality of Life

title: Theme E - Stewardship Policy 2
body: Capitalize on the diverse economic development, housing, and tourism opportunities throughout the Bluegrass Region and engage in discussions to further connect regional economic hubs.

title: Theme E - Stewardship Policy 3
body: Increase regional transportation cooperation and pursue multimodal transportation options, to facilitate inter-county connectivity.

title: Theme E - Stewardship Policy 4
body: Coordinate with surrounding counties to capitalize on the inherent tourism draws of the Bluegrass Region.

title: Theme E - Stewardship Policy 5
body: Fully realize the development potential within Lexington’s Rural Activity Centers while avoiding negative impacts to surrounding agriculture, Rural Settlements, and viewsheds.

title: Theme E - Stewardship Policy 6
body: Identify new compatible agritourism and ecotourism land uses that would enhance Lexington’s economy and provide additional income-generating possibilities for local farmers.

title: Theme E - Stewardship Policy 7
body: Consult with planning departments of adjacent counties to find common Comprehensive Plan goals, objectives and implementation items where shared benefits could be gained by working together.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Agriculture, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities

title: Theme E - Stewardship Policy 8
body: Address economic, environmental, and social sustainability of new development to thoughtfully utilize Lexington’s resources for present needs while considering those of future generations.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Agriculture, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme E - Stewardship Policy 9
body: Follow and implement the recommendations of the 2007 Study of Fayette County’s Small Rural Communities and the 2017 Rural Land Management Plan to protect and preserve Lexington’s rural settlements.

title: Theme E - Growth Policy 1
body: Revisit Infill and Redevelopment Area regulations to ensure they are compatible with Imagine Lexington and are encouraging desired development.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life

title: Theme E - Growth Policy 2
body: Capitalize on the current momentum of downtown development and improvements by working to identify and enhance opportunities for redevelopment.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Quality of Life

title: Theme E - Growth Policy 3
body: Provide varied, abundant, and connected greenspaces throughout Lexington’s urban and rural areas.
field_topics: topic: Agriculture, Greenspace, Health, Community Facilities

title: Theme E - Growth Policy 4
body: Promote the adaptive reuse of existing structures.

title: Theme E - Growth Policy 5
body: Utilize critical evaluation to identify and preserve Lexington’s historic assets, while minimizing unsubstantiated calls for preservation that can hinder the city’s future growth.
field_topics: topic: Economic Development, Quality of Life

title: Theme E - Growth Policy 6
body: Address new development context along the boundaries of existing Historic Districts to enhance historic areas while encouraging infill and redevelopment.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Economic Development, Quality of Life

title: Theme E - Growth Policy 7
body: Lexington should be proactive, highly agile, and adaptable in pursuing changes to transportation and land use policy that harness the benefits of autonomous vehicles (AV) and limit the potential detriments.

title: Theme E - Growth Policy 8
body: Identify catalytic redevelopment opportunities to proactively rezone properties, clear regulatory hurdles, and expedite redevelopment in key areas that will ignite further economic growth.

title: Theme E - Growth Policy 9
body: Support the “Missing Middle Housing” types throughout Lexington.

title: Theme E - Growth Policy 10
body: Support the enhancement, reuse, and/or redevelopment of underutilized property to fit the changing retail landscape, increase development viability, and bolster enhanced mass transit options.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Quality of Life

title: Theme E - Growth Policy 11
body: Imagine Lexington anticipates a variety of land use changes will occur throughout the Urban Service Area and recommends those that are in agreement with the goals, objectives, and policies within this Comprehensive Plan. Land use changes alone in an area are not sufficient to constitute major changes of an economic, physical, or social nature as provided in state statute for the approval of a zone map amendment.
field_topics: topic: Housing, Transportation, Economic Development, Agriculture, Greenspace, Health, Quality of Life, Community Facilities
